website_summaries.verdict: While Sony Reader Pocket Edition PRS-300 has a basic feature set, its $200 price tag, compact size, and Epub file compatibility make it an appealing e-book reader.
pros: With its sharp 5-inch screen, the Sony Reader Pocket Edition is much more compact than the Kindle 2 and fits comfortably in one hand when reading
Sony's eBook Library software is now both Windows- and Mac-compatible, with best sellers costing $9.99 (just like Amazon)
Epub file compatibility lets you access thousands of free classic Google Books and loaner files from many local libraries
also displays Word and PDF files
cons: screen may be too small for some people
limited zoom function with PDF files
cannot display JPEGs or play back MP3 files
not as zippy as the step-up PRS-600
USB charging only works from PCs

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy construction, but confusing controls and dreadful battery
customer_reviews.text: This (used) reader has an e-ink display, which is reflective not luminous and is perfect for bright sunlight. It does not have any wireless capabilities and requires a wired connection to a computer to supply it with material. The device I got would not accept a charge reliably and would suddenly switch off apparently due to w weak battery. Like all e-ink readers, it has a screen size that I consider too small.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Harshman

customer_reviews.title: One one downside.
customer_reviews.text: There's a glare on the screen and I knew that going in. I've been using mine for years now and even though Sony is discontinuing the product in the US I'm still going to hold on to mine for as long as I can. I'm not an avid eBook reader but I use it often enough. It does have a tendency of turning off completely in sleep mode but other than that I haven't run across any glitches. The touch screen works fine albeit a little slow. Even if they were still selling it I probably wouldn't buy it again because the glare is annoying enough to be off-putting but if they fixed that it'd be pretty awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Donna C

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: I just love this thing, it's amazing! Presently I'm enjoying many library e-check outs on my reader. I've also reread many classics (HG Wells, etc). These I've gotten from Gutenberg, Google Books, and a few others. Amazon e-books will not work on the Sony, you want a Kindle if that's the case. Set-up in short. 1. Install Sony software 2. Authenticate computer 3. Authenticate Sony 4. Download books When you connect the reader to your computer make sure it is on otherwise library books will not work when you try to open them.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bigelow

customer_reviews.title: OK....Screen is not lite
customer_reviews.text: For the price I payed, it does the job. The software that came with it was garbage...but I was able to download an updated version. The reader has good weight to it and the controls are easy to use. The screen is like an old Nintendo game boy though, in that, you need to be close to a light source for it to be seen (just like reading a book). It is obviously an old model and has no newer features, but for under $20 , it holds a bunch of titles, is portable, is easy to use and connects to my PC without a hitch...so it's better then not having an ereader. I'll use it a bunch.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Kilduff

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking at ereaders for quite a while and knew that I wanted one, but just didn't know for sure which one. Finally the Sony won out and I have been thrilled ever since. It is really easy to use and I now find myself reading for enjoyment again. I didn't really even know how much I missed reading in the evenings. Even if you don't want to buy books, there are lots of libraries that you can check out ebooks to read. Not to mention, the Sony e store always has some free books that get changed periodically. I really look forward to see where Sony goes with their readers.
customer_reviews.author: T. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Ideal pocket/travel e-reader
customer_reviews.text: PROs: light, easy to use, good quality (I dropped and hit it accidentally many times without any consequences. Once I dropped it in the water and I was sure it's done, but it dried out and continued working), battery lasts for a very long time (!), comfortable button navigation, fits in average size pockets; CONs: no SD slot, reads limited formats Highly recommend this e-reader for people who spend a lot of time traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Nadejda Poznanskaya

customer_reviews.title: It worked fine for this occasion
customer_reviews.text: YES. I only wanted something to download my previously purchased books so I could read them. It worked fine for this occasion.
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: As far as I'm concerned with reading e-books, this device is everything I need. Of course, there are other of the kind, with more advanced features, such as touchscreen, word-search and so on, but, for my purposes, it is perfect. I'd bought it before, but a burglar stole it at my home... I believe that my second purchase says it all about my opinion. Excellent choice, excellent seller, delivered on time.
customer_reviews.author: Klug

customer_reviews.title: Great Reader
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I can add to previous reviews. I love the size (since I wanted something portable) and can easily put it in my backpack or pocket. One surprising thing that I like is the side navigation. It is so quick to use the numerical buttons for menu options. Also, they can be used to navigate to a specific page once you are inside the book. The battery lasts a long time (I have read 6 books and have only charged it once, when the battery indicator showed 2 out of four bars). Everything else I like about it has already been reviewed.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Rules

customer_reviews.title: Get to reading.
customer_reviews.text: Rarely needs a charge. Lasts for weeks. Intuitive design. No glare. Small enough for a back pocket for on-the-go persons. My only gripe... no back-light. A small price to pay for longer battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua A. McGuoirk

customer_reviews.title: Sony reader
customer_reviews.text: This was an identical replacement for my original reader that was stolen on July 2, 2012, during a breakin of our home. It had been a gift from my husband, and I absolutely loved the original. I know, newer models offer more features, but I was really attached to my PRS-300. The new one came with the lighted cover (not available with other makes/models) that I also had with the original. I was able to download the books I had purchased under the old reader, so now this new one has everything I loved about the old one. I'm just glad I was able to get this reader through Amazon and that it was new, not used.
customer_reviews.author: Voracious reader

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Probably not new (contained books) but works well and was reasonable in price.
customer_reviews.author: George Laureyns

customer_reviews.title: Love. Love. Love.
customer_reviews.text: I opted to give up the wifi for the opportunity to read ebooks in .lit and .pdf (and to the tune of close to $100). It was NOT a bad decision on my part. The Reader is comfortable to hold. Easy to use. Easy to load. It holds a charge for quite some time (though you can't gauge on me - as I had it on for 40 hours this weekend). It's small enough for one-handed reading and there are no thumb cramps from trying to keep a book awake. Since I rec'd the Reader, I've read 11 full-length books... and all I can think of is how I can't wait to go home and read more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I've had this now for over three years. Yes, the newer devices can do more, but I always just needed an ereader, not a tablet/smartphone/etc. The screen is great for being out in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: RachoftheJungle

customer_reviews.title: LOVE MY SONY E-READER
customer_reviews.text: Started reading my first book within 30 mins of receiving my Sony e-reader, Downloaded books from the Sony E-BOOK STORE. Simple to use, but came with very little instructions. I printed off the Manuel from the sony website. All 92 pages. I wanted to know how to delete the books that it came pre-loaded with I did not like them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Item works fine and came on time.
customer_reviews.text: I received this reader on time and seems to work fine. At the beginning the charge didn't hold for a long time, but after a few times it started to hold the charge more and more in such a way that it works fine now. I guess that was normal so I'm gratefull for the purchase from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Good little sony:
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put my sony books on that I have on my pc. I had given my other one to my daughter and missed the handiness of carrying my books with me. For anyone just needing to read digital books this is a great ereader for you.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S. Linker

customer_reviews.title: My husband now has this reader and likes it.
customer_reviews.text: My husband now has this reader and likes it. The only downfall is it has to be charged quite often and it doesn't hold a charge even when he hasn't used it for a while
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: Sony Ereader
customer_reviews.text: This device has numerous problems not the least of which is the software glitches. I have experienced many glitches with this device. I will be reading a book and all of a sudden it goes into reset. It will reboot and when it boots back up it doesn't load, it continues to be in what appears a search mode. I think my next reader will be a tablet computer. My advice don't bother with the reader.
customer_reviews.author: RevRJ

customer_reviews.title: Sony Ereader
customer_reviews.text: I love this ereader--it is older so borrowed books from the library don't delete until it is synched with my computer! The smaller screen is the drawback, but I love everything else about it, especially the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Kestrel

customer_reviews.title: great ebook reader
customer_reviews.text: great ebook reader, so far i have over 100 books on it with room for more. the seller was great and answerd all my questions and was very helpful. would recomend this seller and items to friends. thank you unclaimed baggage center!
customer_reviews.author: nickfury

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Manual..difficult to use as a reader but as cheaper okey to give for friends who needs a reader
customer_reviews.author: Helen R. Villaruel

customer_reviews.title: I love the Sony ereader!
customer_reviews.text: Each person in my family has their own Sony ereader. It's easy to use and reads several formats files. Sony's software could use a makeover but since, it's not locked into Sony's ebook store, we can shop other ebooks stores with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Dixon

customer_reviews.title: The Reader I got was advertised on line as new ...
customer_reviews.text: The Reader I got was advertised on line as new but it was not. When I looked through the reader I found books and bookmarks already on the device.. The reader is slow in it's responses. I do not know how to erase all the bookmarks
customer_reviews.author: Dianne M Lalicker

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Reader
customer_reviews.text: I love that this ereader can use several different formats for documents. As a book blogger I love having a device that accepts ePub and PDF. This works well and I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa F- Bookworm Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Nice Reader
customer_reviews.text: I like the reader, but wish it had a back light. It's a nice product for the price. I had a little trouble downloading books, but for the more computer friendly person, it would be fine.
customer_reviews.author: dessert rose

customer_reviews.title: Sony Reader Pocket Edition Silver PRS-300SC
customer_reviews.text: The size is perfect. It has great style and looks sleek. I feel proud to pull it out on a plane. The best 3 things compared to WiFi models are 1) the low price; mine was only $52 NIB, 2) the long battery life; literally weeks, 3) and the lighter weight; about 4 - 6 ounces lighter; which is about 1/2 the weight of a 350-page paperback. I just love it! And if I ever lose it, I'll buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: KZ Keith

customer_reviews.title: Fast Shipping = Good Unit
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to try any type of e-Reader but when I found this one for such a great price, I thought "why not?!" It's user-friendly, and quite simple to use. I have only found a small amount of books to load onto it; I think that paying the full price of a paper novel is ridiculous...however I assume I will eventually find something by an author I like well enough to pay that high price.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne R

customer_reviews.title: Good little reader
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and good size. I bought a table soon after, so I may be selling this one. But it would be great for kids because you can't get to internet
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Good E-Reader
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it works great. Slightly slow at times, but really works for what you want it to. Battery life pretty long as well.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: I thought my old one just like this crapped out so I ordered this one
customer_reviews.text: I thought my old one just like this crapped out so I ordered this one. Received it in a few days. Then got the old one working too which is OK so now my husband has one now too. These are so simple they are great. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Reba

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as a book reader.
customer_reviews.text: It is been a week since unboxing PRS-300. As a book reader it more then perfect, I am only missing the option view Picture. JPEG support only for the bigger model PRS-600. The rendering is still slow but faster than the old model PRS-505. Contrast is better than PRS-505 but the screen is smaller. If you have an image in the ebook you will not be able to zoom in to the image, the three level zoom is only for the text. I was surprise actually of the PRS-300 thickness, the PRS-505 is much slimmer than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ala

customer_reviews.title: above and beyond my expectations
customer_reviews.text: wonderful product, in great shape, exactly as advertised, shipped quickly. I am very happy with this reader. I really liked the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sony PRS-300
customer_reviews.text: Hello! This eReader was the result of my long and hard choices. I was looking for a ereader with good e-ink paper, strong body, a well-known brand and easy to use. Preparing a gift for father's day. By chance, found this ereader at a very competitive price and a new one. When I received was surprised by the pleasant kind, quality, long battery life. My father was very pleased with the gift.
customer_reviews.author: Salzburg

customer_reviews.title: replaced my old one
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pocket reader. my first one stopped functioning after 3 years. I liked it so much that I got another. This one works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: sally weed

customer_reviews.title: my sony ereader
customer_reviews.text: i like it because it's not hard to operate. i learn how to work it fast.i would recommend this yo my friend.
customer_reviews.author: joyce crump

customer_reviews.title: sony readers
customer_reviews.text: it came on 12/24 which was just in time for Christmas and they are very pleased having one as both love to read.
customer_reviews.author: Aleta Walters

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!!! I can't believe I have not got one before. :)
customer_reviews.author: mr.darcylover2010

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Pocket Reader
customer_reviews.text: This Pocket Reader is fantastic. This may sound odd, but I'm happy it doesn't have wifi capability. It feels really solid and sturdy and holds a charge for an unbelievably long time. It's nice to hold an electrical appliance without the inherent dangers of wifi going through my body. I'm a lot more comfortable using it because of this. I was able to download books easily from my computer.
customer_reviews.author: chi-whiz

customer_reviews.title: A Great Reader
customer_reviews.text: The Sony Digital Reader Pocket Edition does exactly what it's supposed to. It's easy to use and has a two week battery life. That's two weeks of "constant" reading. I have never used any of the other digital readers so I can't compare it but it has certainly met all of my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my husband as a gift for Christmas. He uses it all the time. Loves it. terrific
customer_reviews.author: Carol Kuntz

customer_reviews.title: THE best
customer_reviews.text: This seller gave me two free cases and ALLOT of free books on a CD that he had purchased. The reader came fully charged and I was able to start reading and enjoying this device 10 seconds after opening the package! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah86

customer_reviews.title: Sony Reader
customer_reviews.text: Good price. Article arrived early. It would be nice if this Reader had a longer battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Willow

customer_reviews.title: My review on Sony Pocket Reader
customer_reviews.text: It was everything and more than I was expecting!!!!! .....This baby is the perfect little book reader I was searching for at a price in my range.......as Spartacus would say "GRATITUDE"
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Sony Reader
customer_reviews.text: I gave this item to my boyfriend for Christmas along with a Sony Reader Pocket Edition Cover w/Light. He has not put it down! Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly S.

customer_reviews.title: Little companion :)
customer_reviews.text: An amazing light weighted, great looking reader which I take around whenever Im on the move. Its so easy to use and a delight to read with.
customer_reviews.author: Pavithra

customer_reviews.title: Sony Reader
customer_reviews.text: The item was delivered in good condition and arrived sooner than expected. This is an item that I currently use so there was nothing unexpected with this product.
customer_reviews.author: L. Weegar

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure this was what I was looking for. Now I'm sure this is one of my best purchases of the year.
customer_reviews.author: Globetrotter

customer_reviews.title: couldnt use as expected
customer_reviews.text: i had my previous sony taken while my husband was in the hospital. So i bough another thinking i could download the books i already had, but it wouldn't . It would not pare with it . So useless i set it back and got a kindel
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for the one who doesn't want all the WiFi or Touch options. It's the closest to the PRS505 that you can find.
customer_reviews.author: Baelog

customer_reviews.title: Loved the product until .  .  .
customer_reviews.text: I loved the unit but unfortunately after using it for only a week the unit froze and I am in the process of returning the item which is taking an incredibly long time. So all I can is it is great . . . when it is working!!!!
customer_reviews.author: REBECCA FOSTER

customer_reviews.title: Not that good
customer_reviews.text: Bought it two years ago but did not use much in the two years. The screen is small and it is not convenient to operate. Buy a kindle instead!
customer_reviews.author: Yu Xiao

customer_reviews.title: Pink color!
customer_reviews.text: I think there was a mistake with the color, as the one arrived was pink! I was on my trip to Argentina, so I had not enought time to ask for a change. Bad purchase
customer_reviews.author: maru

customer_reviews.title: Slow, bad software, poor international support
customer_reviews.text: In two words: it sucks. If there was an opposite to an Apple product - this would be it: slow, quirky, hardly usable. Sony has had e-readers on the market for many years, so I'm very disappointed to find how pathetic this device+software combo is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very bad
customer_reviews.text: very bad product....it did not turn ON at all..plz people don't buy this stuff..waste of money...i cud not even return this stuff coz it was gift for a fren out of state...
customer_reviews.author: 987chare

product_meta.title: Sony Reader Pocket Edition Silver PRS-300SC
product_meta.description: Enjoy hundreds of books within one handy device with this Sony PRS-300SC 5-inch E-Book Reader!The PRS-300SC features a Vizplex 5-inch E Ink screen with 8-level gray scale that lets you comfortably read electronic books for hours on end without tiring your eyes. It's powered by a i.MX1L processor and includes 512 MB of internal flash memory.The thin and lightweight design feels like you're reading a thin pamphlet and includes a convenient carrying sleeve that's perfect for travel. The Sony PRS-300SC supports PDF, DRM, ePub, BBeB Book, RTF and Word files to give you a wider range of choices. Order your Sony PRS-300SC E-Book Reader today!
feature_bullets: 5-inch Sony Reader Pocket Edition PRS-300SC E-Book Reader General Features: Color: Silver
Lightweight and thin design i.MX1L processor E Ink Technology Vizplex 5-inch screen
800 x 600 resolution 8-level gray scale Carry up to 350 of your favorite books at a time
Access a wide number of online bookstores Paper-like display for easy, natural reading
Intuitive eBook Library software for PC and Mac

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.2 out of 5 stars190 ratings3.2 out of 5 stars
